Key Arguments: The proposed legislation violates Article 19 of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, which guarantees freedom of opinion and expression.
The bill will interfere with the ability of people to receive and impart information through social media.
There is a concern that the government could abuse the powers granted by the bill, leading to censorship.
The submission references the case of Dr. Li Wenliang in China as an example of government suppression of independent voices.
Notable Quotes: The proposed bill will interfere with people’s ability to receive and impart information through social media. It is a violation of Australians’ human rights and must be entirely rejected.
It is not the role of the government to tell people what they can and cannot say or think.
Dr. Li remains a galvanizing figure, a symbol of frustration with the government’s suppression of independent voices in China for freedom of speech.
